definition: to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)
to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: It looks like we're going to have a thundershower.
sentences.chinese: 看样子我们会遇上雷阵雨的。

sentences.english: It looks as if the market will fall before we send you a firm offer.
sentences.chinese: 看样子在我们向您报实盘时市场就会下跌。

sentences.english: She looked ready to collapse at any minute.
sentences.chinese: 她看样子随时都可能垮下来。

sentences.english: Maybe I should ask the gargoyle.He doesn't seem to speak English.
sentences.chinese: 也许我该问问这个滴水嘴兽，看样子他不说英语。

sentences.english: He seems to have opted for a different route.
sentences.chinese: 看样子他已经选择了一条不同的导读。

sentences.english: He went out wearing a pair of clogs. It seems that he went to take a shower.
sentences.chinese: 他穿着一双呱嗒板儿出去了，看样子是去洗澡。

sentences.english: It looks like we are going to have a thunder shower.
sentences.chinese: 看样子我们会遇上雷阵雨。

sentences.english: It looks as though you've blown a fuse.
sentences.chinese: 看样子你把保险丝烧断了。

sentences.english: See exterior, I merely return to one to await a building and please out grandpa Wen.
sentences.chinese: 看样子，我只有回一趟候府，将温爷爷请出来。

sentences.english: It looks as if a storm is brewing.
sentences.chinese: 看样子一场暴风雨即将来临。

sentences.english: He looks very ill.He should have stayed at home.
sentences.chinese: 他看样子病得很严重，本应该待在家里。

sentences.english: Maybe I should ask the gargoyle. He doesn’t seem to speak English.
sentences.chinese: 也许我该问问这个滴水嘴兽，看样子他不说英语。

sentences.english: He was hammering an burning red iron sheet. It seems that he was making a knife.
sentences.chinese: 他锤打着烧红的铁片，看样子是在做一把刀。

sentences.english: Q. You looking to perhaps convince Reebok to make a sleeveless shirt for you?
sentences.chinese: 你看样子好像想让锐步给你做个无袖衫？

definition: to appear to be/to seem as if
contrary to what one might expect/actually/contrariwise/why don't you
if it were not for/but for
returning to our main topic,.../that said,.../again,.../in this connection/in passing/nevertheless,.../anyhow
only/merely/nothing but/no more than/it's just that ...
can it be possible that/could it be
